content.text:
# Initialize New Project

Initialize new project with industry best practices, proper tooling, and framework-specific configurations.

## Instructions

1. **Project Analysis and Setup**
   - Parse the project type and framework from arguments: `$ARGUMENTS`
   - If no arguments provided, analyze current directory and ask user for project type and framework
   - Create project directory structure if needed
   - Validate that the chosen framework is appropriate for the project type

2. **Base Project Structure**
   - Create essential directories (src/, tests/, docs/, etc.)
   - Initialize git repository with proper .gitignore for the project type
   - Create README.md with project description and setup instructions
   - Set up proper file structure based on project type and framework

3. **Framework-Specific Configuration**
   - **Web/React**: Set up React with TypeScript, Vite/Next.js, ESLint, Prettier
   - **Web/Vue**: Configure Vue 3 with TypeScript, Vite, ESLint, Prettier
   - **Web/Angular**: Set up Angular CLI project with TypeScript and testing
   - **API/Express**: Create Express.js server with TypeScript, middleware, and routing
   - **API/FastAPI**: Set up FastAPI with Python, Pydantic models, and async support
   - **Mobile/React Native**: Configure React Native with navigation and development tools
   - **Desktop/Electron**: Set up Electron with renderer and main process structure
   - **CLI/Node**: Create Node.js CLI with commander.js and proper packaging
   - **Library/NPM**: Set up library with TypeScript, rollup/webpack, and publishing config

4. **Development Environment Setup**
   - Configure package manager (npm, yarn, pnpm) with proper package.json
   - Set up TypeScript configuration with strict mode and path mapping
   - Configure linting with ESLint and language-specific rules
   - Set up code formatting with Prettier and pre-commit hooks
   - Add EditorConfig for consistent coding standards

5. **Testing Infrastructure**
   - Install and configure testing framework (Jest, Vitest, Pytest, etc.)
   - Set up test directory structure and example tests
   - Configure code coverage reporting
   - Add testing scripts to package.json/makefile

6. **Build and Development Tools**
   - Configure build system (Vite, webpack, rollup, etc.)
   - Set up development server with hot reloading
   - Configure environment variable management
   - Add build optimization and bundling

7. **CI/CD Pipeline**
   - Create GitHub Actions workflow for testing and deployment
   - Set up automated testing on pull requests
   - Configure automated dependency updates with Dependabot
   - Add status badges to README

8. **Documentation and Quality**
   - Generate comprehensive README with installation and usage instructions
   - Create CONTRIBUTING.md with development guidelines
   - Set up API documentation generation (JSDoc, Sphinx, etc.)
   - Add code quality badges and shields

9. **Security and Best Practices**
   - Configure security scanning with npm audit or similar
   - Set up dependency vulnerability checking
   - Add security headers for web applications
   - Configure environment-specific security settings

10. **Project Validation**
    - Verify all dependencies install correctly
    - Run initial build to ensure configuration is working
    - Execute test suite to validate testing setup
    - Check linting and formatting rules are applied
    - Validate that development server starts successfully
    - Create initial commit with proper project structure
I'll initialize a new project with industry best practices. Let me first analyze the current directory to understand what type of project we're setting up.

1â†’# Business Process Framework
     2â†’
     3â†’A modern, comprehensive business process management application built with Laravel 12, Inertia.js, React, and TypeScript. This application helps organizations map, visualize, and manage their business processes using the RACI responsibility matrix framework.
     4â†’
     5â†’![Laravel](https://img.shields.io/badge/Laravel-12-FF2D20?style=flat&logo=laravel&logoColor=white)
     6â†’![React](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-19-61DAFB?style=flat&logo=react&logoColor=black)
     7â†’![TypeScript](https://img.shields.io/badge/TypeScript-5.7-3178C6?style=flat&logo=typescript&logoColor=white)
     8â†’![Inertia.js](https://img.shields.io/badge/Inertia.js-2.0-9553E9?style=flat&logo=inertia&logoColor=white)
     9â†’
    10â†’## âœ¨ Features
    11â†’
    12â†’### ðŸŽ¯ Core Functionality
    13â†’- **Process Categories**: Organize processes into Strategic Planning Layer, Core Value Chain, and Enabling Processes
    14â†’- **RACI Matrix Management**: Define responsibilities using Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed framework
    15â†’- **Process Diagrams**: Create and manage visual process diagrams with activities
    16â†’- **Mermaid Integration**: Import/export process diagrams using Mermaid syntax
    17â†’- **Drag & Drop**: Intuitive activity reordering with real-time position updates
    18â†’- **Real-time Updates**: Seamless data synchronization without page reloads
    19â†’
    20â†’### ðŸŽ¨ User Experience
    21â†’- **Modern UI**: Built with shadcn/ui components and Tailwind CSS
    22â†’- **Dark Mode Support**: Complete theme switching capability
    23â†’- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-first approach with optimal tablet and desktop experiences
    24â†’- **Toast Notifications**: Real-time feedback for user actions
    25â†’- **Breadcrumb Navigation**: Intuitive navigation with category-aware breadcrumbs
    26â†’- **Pagination**: Efficient data handling for large datasets
    27â†’
    28â†’### ðŸ”’ Security & Performance
    29â†’- **Authentication**: Secure user authentication and session management
    30â†’- **Authorization**: Policy-based access control for all resources
    31â†’- **User Isolation**: Each user sees only their own diagrams and activities
    32â†’- **Input Validation**: Comprehensive server and client-side validation
    33â†’- **Performance Optimized**: Efficient queries and state management
    34â†’
    35â†’## ðŸ›  Tech Stack
    36â†’
    37â†’### Backend
    38â†’- **Laravel 12** - Modern PHP framework
    39â†’- **Inertia.js 2.0** - Server-side rendering with SPA experience
    40â†’- **PHP 8.2+** - Latest PHP features and performance
    41â†’- **SQLite/MySQL** - Flexible database options
    42â†’
    43â†’### Frontend
    44â†’- **React 19** - Latest React with concurrent features
    45â†’- **TypeScript 5.7** - Type-safe development
    46â†’- **Tailwind CSS 4.0** - Utility-first CSS framework
    47â†’- **shadcn/ui** - High-quality component library
    48â†’- **Lucide React** - Beautiful icon library
    49â†’
    50â†’### Development Tools
    51â†’- **Vite 6.0** - Fast build tool and dev server
    52â†’- **ESLint 9** - Code linting and formatting
    53â†’- **Prettier 3** - Code formatting
    54â†’- **Jest** - Frontend testing framework
    55â†’- **PHPUnit** - Backend testing framework
    56â†’
    57â†’### Key Libraries
    58â†’- **@dnd-kit** - Drag and drop functionality
    59â†’- **Mermaid** - Diagram generation and parsing
    60â†’- **Sonner** - Toast notifications
    61â†’- **Vaul** - Drawer components for mobile
    62â†’
    63â†’## ðŸš€ Quick Start
    64â†’
    65â†’### Prerequisites
    66â†’- PHP 8.2 or higher
    67â†’- Node.js 18 or higher
    68â†’- Composer 2.x
    69â†’- pnpm (recommended) or npm
    70â†’
    71â†’### Installation
    72â†’
    73â†’1. **Clone the repository**
    74â†’   ```bash
    75â†’   git clone <repository-url>
    76â†’   cd business-process
    77â†’   ```
    78â†’
    79â†’2. **Install PHP dependencies**
    80â†’   ```bash
    81â†’   composer install
    82â†’   ```
    83â†’
    84â†’3. **Install Node.js dependencies**
    85â†’   ```bash
    86â†’   pnpm install
    87â†’   # or
    88â†’   npm install
    89â†’   ```
    90â†’
    91â†’4. **Environment setup**
    92â†’   ```bash
    93â†’   cp .env.example .env
    94â†’   php artisan key:generate
    95â†’   ```
    96â†’
    97â†’5. **Database setup**
    98â†’   ```bash
    99â†’   # For SQLite (default)
   100â†’   touch database/database.sqlite
   101â†’
   102â†’   # Run migrations and seeders
   103â†’   php artisan migrate --seed
   104â†’   ```
   105â†’
   106â†’6. **Email Configuration (Resend)**
   107â†’   ```bash
   108â†’   # Add to your .env file
   109â†’   MAIL_MAILER=resend
   110â†’   MAIL_FROM_ADDRESS=your-email@yourdomain.com
   111â†’   MAIL_FROM_NAME="Your App Name"
   112â†’   RESEND_KEY=your_resend_api_key_here
   113â†’   ```
   114â†’
   115â†’7. **Build assets**
   116â†’   ```bash
   117â†’   pnpm run build
   118â†’   # or for development
   119â†’   pnpm run dev
   120â†’   ```
   121â†’
   122â†’8. **Start the development server**
   123â†’   ```bash
   124â†’   # Using composer script (recommended)
   125â†’   composer run dev
   126â†’
   127â†’   # Or manually
   128â†’   php artisan serve
   129â†’   ```
   130â†’
   131â†’Visit `http://localhost:8000` to access the application.
   132â†’
   133â†’## ðŸ”§ Development
   134â†’
   135â†’### Development Commands
   136â†’
   137â†’```bash
   138â†’# Start all development services (server, queue, logs, vite)
   139â†’composer run dev
   140â†’
   141â†’# Run with SSR
   142â†’composer run dev:ssr
   143â†’
   144â†’# Frontend development
   145â†’pnpm run dev          # Start Vite dev server
   146â†’pnpm run build        # Build for production
   147â†’pnpm run lint         # Lint code
   148â†’pnpm run format       # Format code with Prettier
   149â†’pnpm run types        # Type checking
   150â†’
   151â†’# Backend development
   152â†’php artisan serve     # Start Laravel server
   153â†’php artisan tinker    # Interactive shell
   154â†’php artisan migrate   # Run migrations
   155â†’php artisan test      # Run tests
   156â†’```
   157â†’
   158â†’### Code Quality
   159â†’
   160â†’```bash
   161â†’# Laravel Pint (PHP formatting)
   162â†’./vendor/bin/pint
   163â†’
   164â†’# ESLint (JavaScript/TypeScript)
   165â†’pnpm run lint
   166â†’
   167â†’# Prettier (Code formatting)
   168â†’pnpm run format
   169â†’
   170â†’# Type checking
   171â†’pnpm run types
   172â†’```
   173â†’
   174â†’## ðŸ§ª Testing
   175â†’
   176â†’### Comprehensive Test Suite
   177â†’The application includes a complete test suite covering:
   178â†’- **Unit Tests**: Model logic and policies
   179â†’- **Feature Tests**: Controller and integration testing
   180â†’- **Browser Tests**: End-to-end workflows
   181â†’- **Frontend Tests**: React component testing
   182â†’
   183â†’### Running Tests
   184â†’
   185â†’```bash
   186â†’# Backend tests
   187â†’php artisan test                    # All tests
   188â†’php artisan test --coverage        # With coverage
   189â†’php artisan test --testsuite=Unit  # Unit tests only
   190â†’php artisan test --testsuite=Feature # Feature tests only
   191â†’
   192â†’# Frontend tests
   193â†’pnpm run test              # Run Jest tests
   194â†’pnpm run test:watch        # Watch mode
   195â†’pnpm run test:coverage     # With coverage
   196â†’pnpm run test:ci          # CI mode
   197â†’```
   198â†’
   199â†’### Test Coverage
   200â†’- **90%+ Backend Coverage**: All critical paths tested
   201â†’- **100% Authorization Coverage**: All policies and permissions
   202â†’- **Complete CRUD Coverage**: All operations tested
   203â†’- **Frontend Component Coverage**: Key components tested
   204â†’
   205â†’## ðŸ“ Project Structure
   206â†’
   207â†’```
   208â†’â”œâ”€â”€ app/
   209â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Http/Controllers/     # Laravel controllers
   210â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Models/              # Eloquent models
   211â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Policies/            # Authorization policies
   212â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Providers/           # Service providers
   213â†’â”œâ”€â”€ database/
   214â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ factories/           # Model factories
   215â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ migrations/          # Database migrations
   216â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ seeders/            # Database seeders
   217â†’â”œâ”€â”€ resources/
   218â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ js/
   219â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ components/      # React components

# Business Process Framework

A modern, comprehensive business process management application built with Laravel 12, Inertia.js, React, and TypeScript. This application helps organizations map, visualize, and manage their business processes using the RACI responsibility matrix framework.

![Laravel](https://img.shields.io/badge/Laravel-12-FF2D20?style=flat&logo=laravel&logoColor=white)
![React](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-19-61DAFB?style=flat&logo=react&logoColor=black)
![TypeScript](https://img.shields.io/badge/TypeScript-5.7-3178C6?style=flat&logo=typescript&logoColor=white)
![Inertia.js](https://img.shields.io/badge/Inertia.js-2.0-9553E9?style=flat&logo=inertia&logoColor=white)

## âœ¨ Features

### ðŸŽ¯ Core Functionality
- **Process Categories**: Organize processes into Strategic Planning Layer, Core Value Chain, and Enabling Processes
- **RACI Matrix Management**: Define responsibilities using Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed framework
- **Process Diagrams**: Create and manage visual process diagrams with activities
- **Mermaid Integration**: Import/export process diagrams using Mermaid syntax
- **Drag & Drop**: Intuitive activity reordering with real-time position updates
- **Real-time Updates**: Seamless data synchronization without page reloads

### ðŸŽ¨ User Experience
- **Modern UI**: Built with shadcn/ui components and Tailwind CSS
- **Dark Mode Support**: Complete theme switching capability
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-first approach with optimal tablet and desktop experiences
- **Toast Notifications**: Real-time feedback for user actions
- **Breadcrumb Navigation**: Intuitive navigation with category-aware breadcrumbs
- **Pagination**: Efficient data handling for large datasets

### ðŸ”’ Security & Performance
- **Authentication**: Secure user authentication and session management
- **Authorization**: Policy-based access control for all resources
- **User Isolation**: Each user sees only their own diagrams and activities
- **Input Validation**: Comprehensive server and client-side validation
- **Performance Optimized**: Efficient queries and state management

## ðŸ›  Tech Stack

### Backend
- **Laravel 12** - Modern PHP framework
- **Inertia.js 2.0** - Server-side rendering with SPA experience
- **PHP 8.2+** - Latest PHP features and performance
- **SQLite/MySQL** - Flexible database options

### Frontend
- **React 19** - Latest React with concurrent features
- **TypeScript 5.7** - Type-safe development
- **Tailwind CSS 4.0** - Utility-first CSS framework
- **shadcn/ui** - High-quality component library
- **Lucide React** - Beautiful icon library

### Development Tools
- **Vite 6.0** - Fast build tool and dev server
- **ESLint 9** - Code linting and formatting
- **Prettier 3** - Code formatting
- **Jest** - Frontend testing framework
- **PHPUnit** - Backend testing framework

### Key Libraries
- **@dnd-kit** - Drag and drop functionality
- **Mermaid** - Diagram generation and parsing
- **Sonner** - Toast notifications
- **Vaul** - Drawer components for mobile

## ðŸš€ Quick Start

### Prerequisites
- PHP 8.2 or higher
- Node.js 18 or higher
- Composer 2.x
- pnpm (recommended) or npm

### Installation

1. **Clone the repository**
   ```bash
   git clone <repository-url>
   cd business-process
   ```

2. **Install PHP dependencies**
   ```bash
   composer install
   ```

3. **Install Node.js dependencies**
   ```bash
   pnpm install
   # or
   npm install
   ```

4. **Environment setup**
   ```bash
   cp .env.example .env
   php artisan key:generate
   ```

5. **Database setup**
   ```bash
   # For SQLite (default)
   touch database/database.sqlite

   # Run migrations and seeders
   php artisan migrate --seed
   ```

6. **Email Configuration (Resend)**
   ```bash
   # Add to your .env file
   MAIL_MAILER=resend
   MAIL_FROM_ADDRESS=your-email@yourdomain.com
   MAIL_FROM_NAME="Your App Name"
   RESEND_KEY=your_resend_api_key_here
   ```

7. **Build assets**
   ```bash
   pnpm run build
   # or for development
   pnpm run dev
   ```

8. **Start the development server**
   ```bash
   # Using composer script (recommended)
   composer run dev

   # Or manually
   php artisan serve
   ```

Visit `http://localhost:8000` to access the application.

## ðŸ”§ Development

### Development Commands

```bash
# Start all development services (server, queue, logs, vite)
composer run dev

# Run with SSR
composer run dev:ssr

# Frontend development
pnpm run dev          # Start Vite dev server
pnpm run build        # Build for production
pnpm run lint         # Lint code
pnpm run format       # Format code with Prettier
pnpm run types        # Type checking

# Backend development
php artisan serve     # Start Laravel server
php artisan tinker    # Interactive shell
php artisan migrate   # Run migrations
php artisan test      # Run tests
```

### Code Quality

```bash
# Laravel Pint (PHP formatting)
./vendor/bin/pint

# ESLint (JavaScript/TypeScript)
pnpm run lint

# Prettier (Code formatting)
pnpm run format

# Type checking
pnpm run types
```

## ðŸ§ª Testing

### Comprehensive Test Suite
The application includes a complete test suite covering:
- **Unit Tests**: Model logic and policies
- **Feature Tests**: Controller and integration testing
- **Browser Tests**: End-to-end workflows
- **Frontend Tests**: React component testing

### Running Tests

```bash
# Backend tests
php artisan test                    # All tests
php artisan test --coverage        # With coverage
php artisan test --testsuite=Unit  # Unit tests only
php artisan test --testsuite=Feature # Feature tests only

# Frontend tests
pnpm run test              # Run Jest tests
pnpm run test:watch        # Watch mode
pnpm run test:coverage     # With coverage
pnpm run test:ci          # CI mode
```

### Test Coverage
- **90%+ Backend Coverage**: All critical paths tested
- **100% Authorization Coverage**: All policies and permissions
- **Complete CRUD Coverage**: All operations tested
- **Frontend Component Coverage**: Key components tested

## ðŸ“ Project Structure

```
â”œâ”€â”€ app/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Http/Controllers/     # Laravel controllers
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Models/              # Eloquent models
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Policies/            # Authorization policies
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Providers/           # Service providers
â”œâ”€â”€ database/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ factories/           # Model factories
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ migrations/          # Database migrations
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ seeders/            # Database seeders
â”œâ”€â”€ resources/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ js/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ components/      # React components
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ layouts/         # Layout components
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ pages/          # Page components
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hooks/          # Custom hooks
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ types/          # TypeScript types
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ views/              # Blade templates
â”œâ”€â”€ routes/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ web.php             # Web routes
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ auth.php            # Authentication routes
â”œâ”€â”€ tests/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Feature/            # Feature tests
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Unit/              # Unit tests
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Browser/           # Browser tests
â””â”€â”€ public/                # Public assets
```

## ðŸ—ƒ Database Schema

### Core Models
- **Categories**: Process categorization (Strategic, Core, Enabling)
- **Processes**: Individual business processes
- **Diagrams**: Process visualization and documentation
- **Activities**: Individual process steps with RACI assignments
- **Users**: Application users with authentication

### Key Relationships
```
Category â†’ Process â†’ Diagram â†’ Activity
                        â†“
                      User (owner)
```

## ðŸ” Authentication & Authorization

### Authentication
- Laravel Breeze integration
- Session-based authentication
- Secure password hashing
- Remember me functionality

### Authorization
- Policy-based access control
- User ownership validation
- Resource-level permissions
- Route protection middleware

## ðŸ“± Responsive Design

The application is fully responsive with:
- **Mobile-first approach** (320px+)
- **Tablet optimization** (768px+)
- **Desktop enhancement** (1024px+)
- **Large screen support** (1536px+)

### Mobile Features
- Drawer navigation
- Touch-friendly interactions
- Optimized layouts
- Swipe gestures

## ðŸŽ¨ UI Components

### Design System
- **shadcn/ui components**: High-quality, accessible components
- **Tailwind CSS**: Utility-first styling
- **Consistent theming**: Light and dark mode support
- **Icon system**: Lucide React icons throughout

### Key Components
- **Cards**: Process and activity display
- **Tables**: RACI matrix with inline editing
- **Modals/Drawers**: Responsive dialogs
- **Forms**: Validated input components
- **Navigation**: Breadcrumbs and sidebar

## ðŸš€ Deployment

### Production Build
```bash
# Install dependencies
composer install --optimize-autoloader --no-dev
pnpm install

# Build assets
pnpm run build

# Optimize Laravel
php artisan config:cache
php artisan route:cache
php artisan view:cache
```

### Environment Variables
Configure your `.env` file for production:
```env
APP_ENV=production
APP_DEBUG=false
APP_URL=https://your-domain.com

# Database configuration
DB_CONNECTION=mysql
DB_HOST=127.0.0.1
DB_PORT=3306
DB_DATABASE=your_database
DB_USERNAME=your_username
DB_PASSWORD=your_password

# Queue configuration (recommended)
QUEUE_CONNECTION=database
```

## ðŸ¤ Contributing

### Development Workflow
1. Fork the repository
2. Create a feature branch (`git checkout -b feature/amazing-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -m 'Add amazing feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin feature/amazing-feature`)
5. Open a Pull Request

### Code Standards
- Follow PSR-12 for PHP code
- Use Prettier/ESLint for JavaScript/TypeScript
- Write tests for new features
- Update documentation as needed

### Pull Request Guidelines
- Include tests for new functionality
- Ensure all tests pass
- Update README if needed
- Follow the existing code style
- Write clear commit messages

## ðŸ“„ License

This project is open-sourced software licensed under the [MIT license](LICENSE).

## ðŸ†˜ Support

### Documentation
- [Laravel Documentation](https://laravel.com/docs)
- [Inertia.js Documentation](https://inertiajs.com)
- [React Documentation](https://react.dev)
- [shadcn/ui Documentation](https://ui.shadcn.com)

### Getting Help
- Check the [Issues](https://github.com/your-repo/issues) page
- Review the test suite for examples
- Read the inline code documentation
